posts.post_content:
The Izzet's answer to [Genesis Wave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Genesis Wave). My mind is boggling with the possibilities! I definitely would have one (or both?) of their guildmages to help, though!  
  
@Lotsofpoopy: No, you **cannot** use this to get free Overloads. A real "pro" would know the rules of the game. Overload is an alternate cost, and this card only permits you to pay the mana cost for free. Either you play the single-target version or you pitch it into the grave. Additional costs, like kickers or buyback, are a different story however.
posts.html:
The Izzet's answer to Genesis Wave. My mind is boggling with the possibilities! I definitely would have one (or both?) of their guildmages to help, though!

@Lotsofpoopy: No, you cannot use this to get free Overloads. A real "pro" would know the rules of the game. Overload is an alternate cost, and this card only permits you to pay the mana cost for free. Either you play the single-target version or you pitch it into the grave. Additional costs, like kickers or buyback, are a different story however.

posts.post_content:
I'd say [Genesis Wave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Genesis Wave) is better because you can get artifacts, enchantments, lands, creatures and Planeswalkers out, while this just gets you instants and sorceries.   
  
Mind you, it's not strictly worse (in any way), because if you've structured to have only instants and sorceries, then this overpowers [Genesis Wave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Genesis Wave) almost immediately.   
  
Also, ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) is kind of hard to get unless going mono.
posts.html:
I'd say Genesis Wave is better because you can get artifacts, enchantments, lands, creatures and Planeswalkers out, while this just gets you instants and sorceries.

Mind you, it's not strictly worse (in any way), because if you've structured to have only instants and sorceries, then this overpowers Genesis Wave almost immediately.

Also, is kind of hard to get unless going mono.

posts.post_content:
Combos insanely with [Mind's Desire.](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Mind's Desire.) Going straight into my [Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind) EDH.  
  
Mind you, you can pay additional costs, like kickers.   
  
For absolute insanity: [Hive Mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hive Mind).  
  
EDIT: After playtesting, I realized you have to make sure you have a large percentage of Instants and Sorceries in your deck (obviously), or you're going to whiff really badly. I once did this for 18 and only got two hits.   
  
I wish this automatically overloaded cards as well. That would be truly epic.
